intro: Polycarpon dunense, commonly known as the Mediterranean sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small white or pale yellow flowers. Polycarpon dunense is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained environments.
